weatherForecast.comment: After an initially slightly cloudy night, an extensive umbrella of clouds moves across the sky and holds back the sun. The peaks remain clear, but the light is often diffuse. From midday onwards it will be increasingly sunny from the west, with the Nockberge and Niedere Tauern remaining the cloudiest for the longest. Still only light winds. It will cool down a little: At 2000 metres it's -1 degree, at 3000 metres -7 degrees.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Danger areas in the wind slab next to the blown-off areas
avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche risk is considerable above 2000 m and low below.
Slab avalanches can still be triggered in some places by low additional loads (individual winter sports enthusiasts) and can reach medium size. Avalanche prone locations are located in particular in north-west, north to south-east facing steep terrain, adjacent to the ridgeline and area distant from ridgelines, behind terrain edges as well as in gullies and bowls. They increase in size and frequency with altitude. Wind slabs often lie directly next to blown-off areas, are easily recognisable and should be avoided at all costs. Cracks and whumpfing collapsing sounds when walking on the snow cover, snowpack are a sign of danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Under the influence of mild air and sunlight, the snow cover, snowpack has settled and become cardboardy up to around 2000 metres. It has at least a thin melt-freeze crust in the morning. At higher altitudes, the wind slab from the weekend is still prone to triggering. The transition to the old snowpack (faceted crystals on/under the crust) usually serves as a weak layer. It consists of layers of faceted crystals, deep rime and melt-freeze crusts; avalanches triggered on the surface can tear through to the ground.
The total snow depth is still well below average. Ridges and ridges are often completely blown off.

tendency.highlights: Directly on the main Tauern ridge with rising southerly winds, partly fresh wind slab problems on the north sides. A slight decrease in danger away from the main ridge.

weatherForecast.comment: After an initially slightly cloudy night, an extensive umbrella of clouds moves across the sky and holds back the sun. The peaks remain clear, but the light is often diffuse. From midday onwards, it will become increasingly sunny from the Pinzgau region, with the Nockberge remaining cloudy for the longest time. Still only light winds. It cools down a little: At 2000 metres it's -1 degree, at 3000 metres -7 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche danger is moderate above 2000 metres and low below.
Slab avalanches can still be triggered in very steep terrain by low additional loads and can reach medium size. Most avalanche prone locations are on north-west, north to south-east facing slopes, behind ridges and in gullies and bowls. The wind slab is easily recognisable and should be avoided. Cracks and whumpfing collapsing sounds when walking on the snow cover, snowpack indicate danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: Under the influence of mild air and sunlight, the snow cover, snowpack has settled and become cardboardy up to around 2000 metres. It has at least a thin melt-freeze crust in the morning. At higher altitudes, the wind slab from the weekend is still prone to triggering in places. The transition to the old snowpack (faceted crystals on/under the crust) usually serves as a weak layer. It consists of layers of faceted crystals, deep rime and melt-freeze crusts. Surface-triggered avalanches can tear through to the ground. The total snow depth is still well below average. Ridges and ridges are often completely blown off.

tendency.highlights: The settlement continues to progress in mild weather.

weatherForecast.comment: After an initially slightly cloudy night, an extensive umbrella of clouds moves across the sky and holds back the sun. The peaks remain clear, but the light is often diffuse. From midday, increasingly sunny from the west. Still only light winds. It cools down a little: At 2000 metres it's -1 degree.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Encrusted surfaces diminish the pleasure of skiing
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is low. Individual wet and mainly small avalanches can spontaneously break loose from very steep terrain with the sunlight. The wind slab from the weekend is hardly triggerable.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow cover, snowpack is moist to wet due to rain, mild air and sunlight and is covered with a crust of melt or rain ice that can rise during the day. Edged persistent weak layers partially weaken the snow base, fundament.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Avoid easily recognisable wind slabs in steep terrain!
